Twin Cities Code Camp 7 - Session Win!

24 Oct 2009

I was really looking forward to the first session of the day at Twin Cities Code Camp. It was [@kevingisi|Keven Gisi] talking about JavaScript testing. There was a problem right away though, the University of Minnesota's Wifi was down. I don't blame Kevin for putting his stuff online. It's the internet, it's always there, right?
With some coordination with the attendees, Kevin was able to present on somebody else's laptop, with a tethered mobile phone. Great teamwork!
I was really looking forward to the first session of the day at Twin Cities Code Camp. It was Keven Gisi talking about JavaScript testing. There was a problem right away though, the University of Minnesota's Wifi was down. I don't blame Kevin for putting his stuff online. It's the internet, it's always there, right? With some coordination with the attendees, Kevin was able to present on somebody else's laptop, with a tethered mobile phone. Great teamwork! The talk was really good and I have a lot of work to do for my future JS coding.

Chris Missal
Austin, Texas
